channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Only the Fed Can Rekindle America's Love for Cars
item.description: New-vehicle sales are stuck in middle gear as high interest rates and high prices push less affluent consumers into the secondhand market.

item.title: Koss surges as meme-stock chatter again swirls around the headphone maker
item.description: Shares of Koss Corp. were surging 18.4% in premarket trades Wednesday as the headphone maker resumed its rally amid a resurgence of interest in meme s...

item.title: Your Old Clothes Are Worth Billions
item.description: Secondhand apparel retail is a booming business, but turning a profit is harder than it sounds.

item.title: U.S. trade deficit jumps in May to highest level in 19 months
Sudden Return of the Trump Trade Sends Treasurys Reeling
item.description: The increasing likelihood of a second Trump administration has helped spark a steep selloff in U.S. government bonds.

item.title: Jobless claims — aka layoffs — rise to 238,000 and stay near one-year high
item.description: Three states, New York, New Jersey and California, accounted for most of the increase

item.title: Tesla Helps Nasdaq Log 22nd Record of the Year
item.description: Six of the Magnificent Seven stocks posted gains.

item.title: A Trump trade war won’t be good for the stock market, warns Dr. Doom
item.description: Nouriel Roubini, the economist who is nicknamed “Dr. Doom” for his often-gloomy predictions, says a Trump win could spark a stock-damaging trade war.

item.title: Investors Give Lifeline to Texas Bank Confronting Real-Estate Risks
item.description: First Foundation raises more than $225 million from Fortress and others.

item.title: ADP says 150,000 private-sector jobs created in June, smallest gain in five months
item.description: U.S. businesses add a modest 150,000 new jobs in June, paycheck company ADP said, to mark the smallest increase in five months, possibly another sign ...
